parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A fellow captive or prisoner. From sun and aichmalotos; a co-captive.
From the same as ariston and archo; best ruling; Aristarchus, a Macedonian.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cousin, nephew. Properly, akin, i.e. a cousin.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
